metadata.name: New File Exclusion Added To Time Machine Via Tmutil - MacOS
metadata.comment: Detects the addition of a new file or path exclusion to MacOS Time Machine via the "tmutil" utility. An adversary could exclude a path from Time Machine backups to prevent certain files from being backed up.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/tmutil')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tmutil')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('addexclusion')))

output.summary: Detects the addition of a new file or path exclusion to MacOS Time Machine via the "tmutil" utility. An adversary could exclude a path from Time Machine backups to prevent certain files from being backed up.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administrator activity References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/master/atomics/T1490/T1490.md#atomic-test-12---disable-time-machine, https://www.loobins.io/binaries/tmutil/
